newsitem.title: USA: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- up 1/8 as retail sits out.
newsitem.headline: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- up 1/8 as retail sits out.

text.p: U.S. municipal bond prices gained about 1/8 point in early trading Thursday, though traders said retail investors had all but abandoned them.
"I'm frightened of these levels," one retail trader said. "The levels are just huge. Everybody's got rate shock."

But a second trader said institutions are helping the market maintain a firm tone. "Retail will just sit on the sidelines or go into stocks at these levels, but we've got an institutional pickup in demand," the trader said.
Thursday's data included jobless claims for the week ended July 12, which the Labor Department said fell to 347,000, close to the 345,000 forecast.
The Commerce Department said June housing starts rose 4.8 percent to 1.452 million, also close to predictions.
Treasuries also gained slightly after the data, with the long bond up 4/32 at 102-1/32 to yield 6.47 percent.
September municipal bond futures rose 7/32 to 120-20/32, while September Treasury bond futures gained 4/32 to 114-26/32. The MOB spread widened to 186 ticks from 183 at the close on Wednesday.
In the secondary market, bids on Dade County, Fla., FGIC 5-1/4s of 2021 were down one basis point to 5.37 percent.
Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority FGIC 5.0s of 2027 were down three basis points, to 5.32 percent, after shedding four basis points in Wednesday's session.
Standard & Poor's Blue List of secondary market offerings again dropped below $1 billion Thursday, falling to $989 million from Wednesday's $1.056 billion.
Municipal bond sales for Thursday were expected to total $422 million in 22 sales, according to Reuters Municipal Bond Information Group.
Negotiated offerings total $133 million in eight sales, with a $32 million Colorado Regional Transportation District offering through George K. Baum & Co. topping the list.
On the competitive side, 14 sales totaling $290 million are scheduled. A $200 million Florida Department of Transportation offering at 1100 EDT is the largest.
